title: Next.js Mastery
description: Become an expert in building scalable, fast, and SEO-friendly web applications using Next.js. This course covers everything from basic routing to server-side rendering and API routes in Next.js.
about: This course covers the core concepts of Next.js, including server-side rendering (SSR), static site generation (SSG), dynamic routing, API routes, and advanced performance optimizations. Gain hands-on experience building a variety of full-stack applications and deploy them to production.

highlights.name: Core Next.js Features
highlights.description: Learn the key features of Next.js, including SSR, SSG, ISR, and static generation.

highlights.name: React Integration
highlights.description: Understand how Next.js works with React and manage dynamic data efficiently.

highlights.name: Server-side Rendering (SSR)
highlights.description: Master the SSR paradigm for building fast, SEO-friendly web apps.

highlights.name: API Routes and Backend Development
highlights.description: Create backend APIs within your Next.js application using API routes.

highlights.name: Deploying Next.js Apps
highlights.description: Learn how to deploy Next.js apps to production using Vercel and other cloud services.

faq.question: Do I need prior experience with React for this course?
faq.answer: Yes, this course assumes you have basic knowledge of React. If you're new to React, we recommend learning React first.

faq.question: What kind of projects will I work on during this course?
faq.answer: You'll work on projects like a personal blog with SSR, an e-commerce app with API routes, and a dashboard application with real-time data.

faq.question: Is Next.js suitable for building SEO-friendly websites?
faq.answer: Yes, Next.js is great for building SEO-friendly applications as it supports server-side rendering and static site generation.

faq.question: Will I receive a certificate after completing the course?
faq.answer: Yes, a certificate will be awarded upon successful completion of the course.

faq.question: What tools will I need to get started?
faq.answer: You will need Node.js installed, a code editor like VSCode, and a basic understanding of Git for version control.
